abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan and
            Credit Project will support the government in (1)
            consolidating recent structural reforms involving price
            liberalization, bank rehabilitation and privatization,
            divestiture of socially-owned industrial enterprises, and
            adjustment of the social safety net, and (2) advancing the
            reform program to the next stage reforming trade and
            agricultural policy, and extending privatization to the
            agricultural sector. The loan and credit will be disbursed
            in two tranches when the adjustment program meets set
            conditions. The second tranche will be released when the
            government (1) implements the new customs tariff and the
            first stage for tariff liberalization, and establishes a
            trade policy unit; (2) adopts an acceptable formula linking
            guaranteed base prices for wheat and tobacco to world market
            prices, eliminates guaranteed base prices or sugarbeet and
            sunflower, shows evidence that legal food price supports
            will end, and submits an agency plan for the security
            operations for food, fuel, and pharmaceuticals; (3) submits
            a draft law on land use and legally adopts new bankruptcy
            and collateral laws, and signs contracts to privatize at
            least 70 percent of enterprises eligible under the present
            agricultural enterprise privatization law, and to privatize
            110 of the Special Restructuring Program enterprise business units.
